result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Status conference on January 12, 2023 at 04:00 pm.

4:14 PM Defendant Ryan Adam Douglas appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Shelley Cupino in court for Ryan Adam Douglas.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State advised that drug court may be possible, deft. has been evaluated by the drug court team and does qualify. Deft. has deferred judgement in Br. 2 case, not yet revoked. This case may resolve in Br. 2. Defense to follow up with agent re: treatment program. Atty Cupino states that the deft. is not getting revoked - may be filing a bond motion.
Status conference scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 04:00 pm.

1:47 PM Defendant Ryan Adam Douglas appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Shelley Cupino in court for Ryan Adam Douglas.  Attorney Joel N Urmanski in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Cupino requests bond lower to $1500.00 cash. State objects to lower cash bond. Def has applied to Drug Court but has not been accepted. Court denies motion to lower bond. No offer received yet, Atty Cupino requests time to talk with Def before going forward.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages. 
Remain within the State of Wisconsin. 
Comply with day reporting requirements-Monitor drug abstinence through UA's.
